structure.unit: SCHOOL EMPLOYEES -- TEACHERS' RETIREMENT AND TENURE

law.catch_line: Teachers to enforce course of study and use of books -- Removal for failure.
law.text: Each teacher in the public schools shall enforce the course of study, the use of the legally authorized textbooks, and the rules and regulations prescribed for the schools. If any teacher willfully refuses or neglects to comply with the law or such rules and regulations, the local superintendent may remove him at any time. When so removed the teacher shall receive payment only for the time taught.
law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. IV, sec. 241, effective July 13, 1990. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4503-3.
